hibernation_timeout_seconds.description:
The new hibernation timeout in seconds.

Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 86400 (24 hours).

expires_at.description: UTC Timestamp until when this token is valid. Omitting this field will create a token without an expiry.

description.description: Sandbox description. Maximum 255 characters. Defaults to description of original sandbox.

is_frozen.description: Sandbox frozen status. When true, edits to the sandbox are restricted. Defaults to frozen status of the original sandbox.

path.description: Path to the collection where the new sandbox should be stored. Defaults to "/". If no collection exists at the given path, it will be created.

privacy.description: Sandbox privacy. 0 for public, 1 for unlisted, and 2 for private. Subject to the minimum privacy restrictions of the workspace. Defaults to the privacy of the original sandbox.

start_options.description: Optional VM start configuration. If provided, the sandbox VM will be started immediately after creation.

automatic_wakeup_config.description: Configuration for when the VM should automatically wake up from hibernation

http.description: Whether the VM should automatically wake up on HTTP requests (excludes WebSocket requests)

websocket.description: Whether the VM should automatically wake up on WebSocket connections

hibernation_timeout_seconds.description:
The time in seconds after which the VM will hibernate due to inactivity.
Must be a positive integer between 1 and 86400 (24 hours).
Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes) if not specified.

ipcountry.description: This determines in which cluster, closest to the given country the VM will be started in. The format is ISO-3166-1 alpha-2. If not set, the VM will be started closest to the caller of this API. This will only be applied when a VM is run for the first time, and will only serve as a hint (e.g. if the template of this sandbox runs in EU cluster, this sandbox will also run in the EU cluster).

tier.description:
Determines which specs to start the VM with. If not specified, the VM will start with the default specs for the workspace.

You can only specify a VM tier when starting a VM that is inside your workspace. Specifying a VM tier for someone else's sandbox will return an error.

Not all tiers will be available depending on the workspace subscription status, and higher tiers incur higher costs. Please see codesandbox.io/pricing for details on specs and costs.

tags.description: Tags to set on the new sandbox, if any. Will not inherit tags from the source sandbox.

title.description: Sandbox title. Maximum 255 characters. Defaults to title of original sandbox with (forked).

next_page.description: The number of the next page, if any. If `null`, the current page is the last page of records.

api.description: Meta information about the CodeSandbox API

auth.description: Meta information about the current authentication context

TokenUpdateRequest.description: Updateable fields for API Tokens. Omitting a field will not update it; explicitly passing null or an empty list will clear the value.

default_version.description: API Version to use, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD

description.description: Description of this token, for instance where it will be used.

expires_at.description: Expiry time of this token. Cannot be set in the past, and cannot be changed for tokens that have already expired. Pass null to make this token never expire.

scopes.description: Which scopes to grant this token. The given scopes will replace the current scopes, revoking any that are no longer present in the list.

TokenUpdateRequest.title: TokenUpdateRequest

automatic_wakeup_config.description: Configuration for when the VM should automatically wake up from hibernation

http.description: Whether the VM should automatically wake up on HTTP requests (excludes WebSocket requests)

websocket.description: Whether the VM should automatically wake up on WebSocket connections

hibernation_timeout_seconds.description:
The time in seconds after which the VM will hibernate due to inactivity.
Must be a positive integer between 1 and 86400 (24 hours).
Defaults to 300 seconds (5 minutes) if not specified.

ipcountry.description: This determines in which cluster, closest to the given country the VM will be started in. The format is ISO-3166-1 alpha-2. If not set, the VM will be started closest to the caller of this API. This will only be applied when a VM is run for the first time, and will only serve as a hint (e.g. if the template of this sandbox runs in EU cluster, this sandbox will also run in the EU cluster).

tier.description:
Determines which specs to start the VM with. If not specified, the VM will start with the default specs for the workspace.

You can only specify a VM tier when starting a VM that is inside your workspace. Specifying a VM tier for someone else's sandbox will return an error.

Not all tiers will be available depending on the workspace subscription status, and higher tiers incur higher costs. Please see codesandbox.io/pricing for details on specs and costs.

expires_at.description: UTC Timestamp until when this token is valid. Omitting this field will create a token without an expiry.

tier.description:
Determines which specs to update the VM with.

Not all tiers will be available depending on the workspace subscription status, and higher tiers incur higher costs. Please see codesandbox.io/pricing for details on specs and costs.

name.description: Name for the new workspace. Maximum length 64 characters.

VMCreateTagRequest.description: Create a tag for a list of VM IDs
VMCreateTagRequest.title: VMCreateTagRequest

items.description: Trusted domains that are allowed to access sandbox previews.

description.description: Optional text description of the sandbox. Defaults to no description.

entry.description: Filename of the entrypoint of the sandbox.

external_resources.description: Array of strings with external resources to load.

binary_content.description: If the file has binary (non plain-text) contents, place the base-64 encoded contents in this key. Should be empty or missing if `is_binary` is `false`.

code.description: If the file is non-binary in nature, place the (escaped) plain text contents in this key. Should be empty or missing if `is_binary` is `true`.

is_binary.description: Whether the file contains binary contents.

files.description: Map of `path => file` where each file is a map.

is_frozen.description: Whether changes to the sandbox are disallowed. Defaults to `false`.

npm_dependencies.description: Map of dependencies and their version specifications.

path.description: Path to the collection where the new sandbox should be stored. Defaults to "/". If no collection exists at the given path, it will be created.

privacy.description: 0 for public, 1 for unlisted, and 2 for private. Privacy is subject to certain restrictions (team minimum setting, drafts must be private, etc.). Defaults to public.

runtime.description: Runtime to use for the sandbox. Defaults to `"browser"`.

tags.description: List of string tags to apply to the sandbox. Only the first ten will be used. Defaults to no tags.

template.description: Name of the template from which the sandbox is derived (for example, `"static"`).

title.description: Sandbox title. Maximum 255 characters. Defaults to no title.

default_version.description: API Version to use, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Defaults to the latest version at time of creation.

description.description: Description of this token, for instance where it will be used.

expires_at.description: UTC Timestamp until when this token is valid. Omitting this field will create a token without an expiry.

scopes.description: Which scopes to grant this token. The given scopes will replace the current scopes, revoking any that are no longer present in the list.

git_user_email.description: Git user email to configure for this session

git_user_name.description: Git user name to configure for this session

capabilities.description: List of capabilities that Pitcher has

permissions.description: The permissions of the current session

pitcher_token.description: Token to authenticate with Pitcher (the agent running inside the VM)

pitcher_url.description: WebSocket URL to connect to Pitcher

user_workspace_path.description: Path to the user's workspace in the VM

username.description: The Linux username created for this session

start_response.description: VM start response. Only present when start_options were provided in the request.

get.description:
List sandboxes from the current workspace with optional filters.
Results are limited to a maximum of 50 sandboxes per request.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter by
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Field to order results by
parameters.name: order_by

parameters.description: Order direction
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: Maximum number of sandboxes to return in a single response
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Page number to return
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: If true, only returns VMs for which a heartbeat was received in the last 30 seconds.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Short ID of the sandbox to retrieve
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Short ID of the sandbox to fork
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Shortid of the sandbox to revoke tokens for
parameters.name: id

get.description: List information about the preview tokens associated with the current sandbox

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: id

parameters.description: ID of the token to update. Does not accept the token itself.

get.description: List information about currently running VMs. This information is updated roughly every 30 seconds, so this data is not guaranteed to be perfectly up-to-date.
get.summary: List information about currently running VMs

post.description: Creates a new tag for a VM.
post.summary: Create a new tag for a VM

post.description:
Suspends a running VM, saving a snapshot of its memory and running processes

This endpoint may take an extended amount of time to return (30 seconds). If the VM is not
currently running, it will return an error (404).

Unless later shut down by request or due to inactivity, a hibernated VM can be resumed with
minimal latency.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

put.description:
Updates the hibernation timeout of a running VM.

This endpoint can only be used on VMs that belong to your team's workspace.
The new timeout must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 86400 seconds (24 hours).

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Creates a new session on a running VM. A session represents an isolated Linux user, with their own container.
A session has a single use token that the user can use to connect to the VM. This token has specific permissions (currently, read or write).
The session is identified by a unique session ID, and the Linux username is based on the session ID.

The Git user name and email can be configured via parameters.

This endpoint requires the VM to be running. If the VM is not running, it will return a 404 error.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

post.summary: Create a new session on a VM

post.description:
Stops a running VM, ending all currently running processes

This endpoint may take an extended amount of time to return (30 seconds). If the VM is not
currently running, it will return an error (404).

Shutdown VMs require additional time to start up.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

put.description:
Updates the specifications (CPU, memory, storage) of a running VM.

This endpoint can only be used on VMs that belong to your team's workspace.
The new tier must not exceed your team's maximum allowed tier.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Start a virtual machine for the sandbox (devbox) with the given ID

While the `sandbox:read` scope is required for this endpoint, the resulting VM will have
permissions according to the `sandbox:edit_code` scope. If present, the returned token will
have write permissions to the contents of the VM. Otherwise, the returned token will grant
only read-only permissions.

This endpoint is subject to special rate limits related to concurrent VM usage.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

post.description:
Updates the specifications (CPU, memory, storage) of a running VM.

This endpoint can only be used on VMs that belong to your team's workspace.
The new tier must not exceed your team's maximum allowed tier.

parameters.description: Sandbox ID
parameters.name: id

get.description: List all trusted preview hosts for the current team

post.description: Add one or more trusted domains that are allowed to access sandbox previews for this workspace.

put.description: Replace the list of trusted domains that are allowed to access sandbox previews for this workspace.
